item.description:
Update: Dinner Saturday night will be :

Italian Style Meatloaf with Spaghetti and Marinara.

Grilled Sliced Eggplant, Penne Pasta with Winter Squash and Parmesan cheese sauce.

Salad, Garlic Bread, and either Apple Pie and Ice Cream or Chocolate Cream Pie. 12$ 

The price for that is now $12.

 

The air is crisp and the leaves are starting to change. If you'd like to visit the club and check out what the White Mountains and North Conway has to offer in the fall, this is a great weekend.  Top on the agenda for the weekend will be the Cranmore Mountain Aerial Adventure Park Saturday morning. There are 4 available courses, all included for the $45 ticket:

Aerial Adventure Park is an aerial forest ropes course consisting of 4 individual, elevated courses for different ability levels consisting of dozens of elements that will challenge you to new heights! The Aerial Adventure course is 3 hours of fun no matter what course you choose:

  • Yellow Course
  • Green Course
  • Blue Course
  • Black Course

You must complete a lower level before moving onto the blue and black courses.

Each course varies in terms of elevation and the strenuousness of the challenges. Elements include rope bridges, ladders, cargo nets, zip lines and more. All courses are self guided and every person is snapped into a guide line.

Sunday, we'll head back to Cranmore for 18 holes of disc golf up and down the mountain.  Also included in the ticket ($29): mountain coaster, giant swing and other rides and activities.  You can see more details here: http://www.cranmore.com/summer/rides-activi....

 

Schedule:

Fri

Meet up at the club after work and relax by the fireplace.

Sat

Head for the ropes course in the morning, then grab lunch at Flatbreads in North Conway.  After the adventure, there will some fun stuff for Sat afternoon/evening, including a catered dinner at the club.  ($12)

Sun

Disc golf and rides at Cranmore, and grab dinner at a local area restaurant.

Mon

Head home!

 

All activities above are optional-you can do one or all!  There are always lots of great options in the mountains such as hiking and kayaking. 

Full details will be sent to all “Yes” RSVPs.

Costs:

Non-members: $15 per night lodging fee
Saturday dinner: $12

Ropes course: $45 (paid at Cranmore individually)

Disc golf/rides: $29 (paid at Cranmore individually)
item.name: Ropes Course and Disc Golf Weekend
